alert.note: Alert for Orange County Coastal; San Diego County Coastal Areas (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Beach Hazards Statement issued December 21 at 9:29PM PST until December 24 at 12:00PM PST by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Beach flooding associated with King Tides near 7 feet Friday and Saturday mornings. * WHERE...Impacted beaches include Mission Beach, Pacific Beach, Seaside and Cardiff State Beaches, Oceanside Strand, Balboa Peninsula in Newport Beach, and Sunset Beach. * IMPACTS...The King Tides combined with surf of 3 to 5 feet will produce minor flooding of low lying beach parking lots and beach boardwalks. Extreme low tides of -1.8 feet each afternoon may also impact boats in harbors and affect navigation. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...King Tide times in SoCal this week: Thursday 12/22: High tide 6.8 ft at 7:25 AM. Low tide -1.5 ft at 2:47 PM. Friday 12/23: High tide 7.0 ft at 8:08 AM. Low tide -1.8 ft at 3:33 PM. Saturday 12/24: High tide 7.0 ft at 8:54 AM. Low tide -1.8 ft at 4:20 PM. Sunday 12/25: High tide 6.7 ft at 9:42 AM. Low tide -1.5 ft at 5:08 PM.
info.instruction: Avoid flooded beach parking lots and boardwalks during the times of high tide.

area.areaDesc: Orange County Coastal; San Diego County Coastal Areas
